revised_title: Life and Scientific Contributions of John Sebastian Bach Stopford
tldr: The article is a biographical memoir of John Sebastian Bach Stopford, a distinguished anatomist and neurologist, who made significant contributions to the understanding of cutaneous and deep sensibility, peripheral nerve injuries, and the autonomic nervous system. Stopford also played a crucial role in the development and administration of Manchester University's Medical School and served as Vice-Chancellor of the University.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Anatomy and Neurology
